project_abstract.cdata: The project would directly increase the incomes of about 12,000 low-income rural households by financing the fringe and rehabilitation scheme elements of the Federal Land Consolidation and Rehabilitation Authority (FELCRA) program for the Fourth Plan Period, extending to a total of about 84,000 acres. This would cover development of about 50 proposed fringe schemes, and the rehabilitation of about 40 existing unassisted land development schemes. The project would also provide for the construction of two palm oil mills. About 75 percent of the beneficiaries would be rural households whose present incomes fall below the poverty line. At full development, the project would enable these beneficiaries to more than double their incomes.
